what: Fitting the DPMM to complete data
title: DPMM
text: can fit DPMM complete dataset. ‘mcmc_iterations’ represents long MCMC chain run (longer better), ‘L’ represents number clusters fitted, ‘mcmc_chain’ represents number MCMC chains fitted function ‘standardise’ chooses whether continuous values standardised.

previous_headings: Overview > Fitting the DPMM to complete data
title: DPMM
text: ‘DPMM’ package provides several diagnostic tools. function ‘plot_alpha’ takes posterior samples fitted DPMM explores whether shows evidence convergence (important Bayesian inference). plot divided three panels: : number components used iteration fitted model. B: average number individuals ranked components (discarding burn-‘nburn’, every ‘thinning’ value). C: trace plot alpha values (governs number components).  can also check fit DPMM ensure random samples fitted DPMM covariate space original data.
code: plot_alpha(posteriors, nburn = 10000, thinning = 1) plot_ggpairs(posteriors,               newdata = dataset_1,               nburn = 10000)

previous_headings: Overview > Fitting the DPMM to complete data
title: DPMM
text: can introduce missingness dataset check whether DPMM predicting values right cluster. case, introduce missingness ‘X1’ patients one clusters. make predictions fitted DPMM. can check whether values predicted right place. First, calculate credible intervals predicted value. standardise original values match standardisation DPMM. Lastly, plot credible intervals true values.
code: rows <- 1:50 dataset_missing <- dataset_1 dataset_missing_predict <- dataset_missing[rows,] dataset_missing_predict[,"X1"] <- as.numeric(NA) posteriors.prediction <- predict_dpmm_fit(posteriors,                                            newdata = dataset_missing_predict,                                           samples = seq(10000,20000, 100)) low_q <- NULL median_q <- NULL high_q <- NULL for (i in 1:length(posteriors.prediction)) {   low_q <- c(low_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.05)))   median_q <- c(median_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.5)))   high_q <- c(high_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.95))) } standardised_values <- (dataset_missing[rows,"X1"]-posteriors$mean_values[1])/posteriors$sd_values[1] library(tidyverse) cbind(standardised_values,low_q, median_q,high_q) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("observed", "low","median","high")) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = observed, y = median)) +   geom_errorbar(aes(x = observed, ymin = low, ymax = high)) +   geom_abline(aes(intercept = 0, slope = 1))

title: Worked Examples
text: Dataset 1 comprised two distinct clusters, values predictor variables overlap . Therefore, one variable informative .
code: data(dataset_1)  GGally::ggpairs(dataset_1)

title: Worked Examples
text: can fit DPMM complete dataset. ‘mcmc_iterations’ represents long MCMC chain run (longer better), ‘L’ represents number clusters fitted, ‘mcmc_chain’ represents number MCMC chains fitted function ‘standardise’ chooses whether continuous values standardised. can check fit DPMM ensure random samples fitted DPMM covariate space original data.  can introduce missingness dataset check whether DPMM predicting values right cluster. case, introduce missingness ‘X1’ patients one clusters. make predictions fitted DPMM. can check whether values predicted right place. First, calculate credible intervals predicted value. standardise original values match standardisation DPMM. Lastly, plot credible intervals true values.
code: posteriors <- runModel(dataset_1,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         mcmc_chains = 2,                         standardise = TRUE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, tauL, v, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> conjugate sampler (17) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (1000 elements) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| plot_ggpairs(posteriors,               newdata = dataset_1,               nburn = 1500) rows <- 1:50 dataset_missing <- dataset_1 dataset_missing_predict <- dataset_missing[rows,] dataset_missing_predict[,"X1"] <- as.numeric(NA) posteriors.prediction <- predict_dpmm_fit(posteriors,                                            newdata = dataset_missing_predict,                                           samples = seq(1500,2500, 25)) low_q <- NULL median_q <- NULL high_q <- NULL for (i in 1:length(posteriors.prediction)) {   low_q <- c(low_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.05)))   median_q <- c(median_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.5)))   high_q <- c(high_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.95))) } standardised_values <- (dataset_missing[rows,"X1"]-posteriors$mean_values[1])/posteriors$sd_values[1] cbind(standardised_values,low_q, median_q,high_q) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("observed", "low","median","high")) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = observed, y = median)) +   geom_errorbar(aes(x = observed, ymin = low, ymax = high)) +   geom_abline(aes(intercept = 0, slope = 1))

title: Worked Examples
text: can also fit model without standardising. can check fit DPMM.  use dataset make prediction newly fitted DPMM. , , check whether credible intervals close original values.
code: posteriors <- runModel(dataset_1,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         mcmc_chains = 2,                         standardise = FALSE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, tauL, v, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> conjugate sampler (17) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (1000 elements) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| plot_ggpairs(posteriors, dataset_1, nburn = 1500) posteriors.prediction <- predict_dpmm_fit(posteriors,                                            newdata = dataset_missing_predict,                                           samples = seq(1500,2500, 25)) low_q <- NULL median_q <- NULL high_q <- NULL for (i in 1:length(posteriors.prediction)) {   low_q <- c(low_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.05)))   median_q <- c(median_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.5)))   high_q <- c(high_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.95))) }  cbind(dataset_missing[1:50,"X1"],low_q, median_q,high_q) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("observed", "low","median","high")) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = observed, y = median)) +   geom_errorbar(aes(x = observed, ymin = low, ymax = high)) +   geom_abline(aes(intercept = 0, slope = 1))

text: can also fit DPMM missing data present original dataset. Let’s introduce misisngness clusters. fit DPMM whilst standardising values. can check well missing values imputed model fitting. , checking chain 1, can repeated chains.
code: dataset_missing <- dataset_1 dataset_missing[1,"X1"] <- NA dataset_missing[501,"X1"] <- NA posteriors <- runModel(dataset_missing,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         mcmc_chains = 2,                         standardise = TRUE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, tauL, v, x_cont_miss, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> conjugate sampler (17) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> conditional_RW sampler (2) #>   - x_cont_miss[1, 1:2] #>   - x_cont_miss[2, 1:2]  #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (998 elements) #>   - zmiss[]  (2 elements) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| intercept_1 = (dataset_1[1,"X1"]-posteriors$mean_values[1])/posteriors$sd_values[1] ggplot() +   geom_density(aes(x = as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%                      select(`x_cont_miss[1, 1]`)%>%                      dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%                      unlist())) +   geom_vline(aes(xintercept = intercept_1)) intercept_2 = (dataset_1[501,"X1"]-posteriors$mean_values[1])/posteriors$sd_values[1] ggplot() +   geom_density(aes(x = as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%                      select(`x_cont_miss[2, 1]`)%>%                      dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%                      unlist())) +   geom_vline(aes(xintercept = intercept_2))

title: Worked Examples
text: can fit DPMM complete dataset. check fit DPMM versus original data.  can introduce missingness dataset check whether DPMM predicting values right cluster. case, introduce missingness ‘X2’ patients one clusters. make predictions fitted DPMM. can check whether values predicted right place. standardise original values match standardisation DPMM. Lastly, plot credible intervals true values.
code: posteriors <- runModel(dataset_2,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         mcmc_chains = 2) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, phiL, tauL, v, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> conjugate sampler (23) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - phiL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (1000 elements) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| plot_ggpairs(posteriors,               newdata = dataset_2,               nburn = 1500) rows <- 950:1000 dataset_missing <- dataset_2 dataset_missing_predict <- dataset_missing[rows,] dataset_missing_predict[,"X2"] <- as.numeric(NA) posteriors.prediction <- predict_dpmm_fit(posteriors,                                            newdata = dataset_missing_predict,                                            samples = seq(1500,2500, 25)) low_q <- NULL median_q <- NULL high_q <- NULL for (i in 1:length(posteriors.prediction)) {   low_q <- c(low_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.05)))   median_q <- c(median_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.5)))   high_q <- c(high_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.95))) } standardised_values <- (dataset_missing[rows,"X2"]-posteriors$mean_values[2])/posteriors$sd_values[2] cbind(standardised_values,low_q, median_q,high_q) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("observed", "low","median","high")) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = observed, y = median)) +   geom_errorbar(aes(x = observed, ymin = low, ymax = high)) +   geom_abline(aes(intercept = 0, slope = 1))

title: Worked Examples
text: can exercise adding missingness ‘X3’ instead. make predictions fitted DPMM. can check whether values predicted right place plotting table original values versus predicted values.
code: rows <- 950:1000 dataset_missing <- dataset_2 dataset_missing_predict <- dataset_missing[rows,] dataset_missing_predict[,"X3"] <- factor(NA, levels = levels(dataset_2[,"X3"])) posteriors.prediction <- predict_dpmm_fit(posteriors,                                            newdata = dataset_missing_predict,                                            samples = seq(1500,2500, 25)) predicted <- NULL for (i in 1:length(posteriors.prediction)) {   var <- table(unlist(posteriors.prediction[i]))   predicted <- c(predicted, names(var[var==max(var)])) } predicted <- as.numeric(predicted)  cbind(dataset_2[rows,"X3"],predicted) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("observed", "predicted")) %>%   mutate(observed = factor(observed),          predicted = factor(predicted)) %>%   table() #>         predicted #> observed  2 #>        2 51

title: Worked Examples
text: can also fit DPMM missing data ‘X3’ present original dataset. Let’s introduce misisngness clusters. fit DPMM whilst standardising values. can check well missing values imputed model fitting. , checking chain 1, can repeated chains.
code: dataset_missing <- dataset_2 dataset_missing[2,"X3"] <- NA dataset_missing[501,"X3"] <- NA posteriors <- runModel(dataset_missing,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                        L = 6,                         standardise = FALSE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, phiL, tauL, v, x_disc_miss, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> posterior_predictive sampler (2) #>   - x_disc_miss[]  (2 elements) #> conjugate sampler (23) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - phiL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (998 elements) #>   - zmiss[]  (2 elements) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_disc_miss[1, 1]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() cbind(imputed_values, rep(as.numeric(dataset_2[2,"X3"]), 1501)) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("Predicted","True")) %>%   table() #>          True #> Predicted    1 #>         1 1497 #>         2    4  imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_disc_miss[2, 1]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() cbind(imputed_values, rep(as.numeric(dataset_2[501,"X3"]), 1501)) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("Predicted","True")) %>%   table() #>          True #> Predicted    2 #>         1    2 #>         2 1499

title: Worked Examples
text: can fit DPMM complete dataset. check fit DPMM versus original data.  can introduce missingness dataset check whether DPMM predicting values correctly. case, introduce missingness ‘Y’ 100 random patients. make predictions fitted DPMM. can check whether values predicted right place.
code: posteriors <- runModel(dataset_4,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         standardise = FALSE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, phiL, tauL, v, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:4, 1:4]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> conjugate sampler (23) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - phiL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> categorical sampler (500) #>   - z[]  (500 elements) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| plot_ggpairs(posteriors,               newdata = dataset_4,               nburn = 1500) rows <- sample(1:nrow(dataset_4), 100) dataset_missing <- dataset_4 dataset_missing_predict <- dataset_missing[rows,] dataset_missing_predict[,"Y"] <- as.numeric(NA) posteriors.prediction <- predict_dpmm_fit(posteriors,                                            dataset_missing_predict,                                            samples = seq(1500,2500, 25)) low_q <- NULL median_q <- NULL high_q <- NULL for (i in 1:length(posteriors.prediction)) {   low_q <- c(low_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.05)))   median_q <- c(median_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.5)))   high_q <- c(high_q, quantile(unlist(posteriors.prediction[[i]][]), probs = c(0.95))) }  cbind(dataset_4[rows,"Y"],low_q, median_q,high_q) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("observed", "low","median","high")) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = observed, y = median)) +   geom_errorbar(aes(x = observed, ymin = low, ymax = high)) +   geom_abline(aes(intercept = 0, slope = 1))

title: Worked Examples
text: Dataset 5 comprised two distinct clusters, values ‘X1’ overlap clusters, ‘X2’ values overlap, ‘X3’ categorical distinct clusters, ‘X4’ categorical fours levels cluster two levels. ‘X2’/‘X3’/‘X4’ informative cluster membership.
code: data(dataset_5)  GGally::ggpairs(dataset_5)

title: Worked Examples
text: can fit DPMM missing data “X1”/“X3” present original dataset. Let’s introduce misisngness clusters. fit DPMM whilst standardising values. can check well missing values imputed model fitting. , checking chain 1, can repeated chains.
code: dataset_missing <- dataset_5 dataset_missing[1,"X1"] <- NA dataset_missing[2,"X3"] <- factor(NA, levels = levels(dataset_5[,"X3"])) posteriors <- runModel(dataset_missing,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         mcmc_chains = 2,                         standardise = FALSE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, phiL, tauL, v, x_cont_miss, x_disc_miss, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> posterior_predictive sampler (1) #>   - x_disc_miss[]  (1 element) #> conjugate sampler (29) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - phiL[]  (12 multivariate elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> conditional_RW sampler (1) #>   - x_cont_miss[1, 1:2]  #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (998 elements) #>   - zmiss[]  (2 elements) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_cont_miss[1, 1]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() ggplot() +   geom_density(aes(x = imputed_values)) +   geom_vline(aes(xintercept = dataset_5[1,"X1"])) imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_disc_miss[2, 1]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() cbind(imputed_values, rep(dataset_5[2,"X3"], rep = 1500)) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("Predicted","True")) %>%   table() #>          True #> Predicted    1 #>         1 1496 #>         2    5

title: Worked Examples
text: can fit DPMM missing data ‘X1’/‘X2’/‘X3’ present original dataset. Let’s introduce misisngness clusters. fit DPMM whilst standardising values. can check well missing values imputed model fitting. , checking chain 1, can repeated chains.
code: dataset_missing <- dataset_5 dataset_missing[1,c("X1", "X2")] <- NA dataset_missing[1,"X3"] <- factor(NA, levels = levels(dataset_5[,"X3"])) posteriors <- runModel(dataset_missing,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         standardise = FALSE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, phiL, tauL, v, x_cont_miss, x_disc_miss, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> posterior_predictive sampler (2) #>   - x_disc_miss[]  (1 element) #>   - x_cont_miss[1, 1:2]  #> conjugate sampler (29) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - phiL[]  (12 multivariate elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (999 elements) #>   - zmiss[]  (1 element) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| imputed_values_1 <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_cont_miss[1, 1]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() imputed_values_2 <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_cont_miss[1, 2]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = imputed_values_1, y = imputed_values_2), alpha = 0.6) +   geom_point(aes(x = dataset_5[1,"X1"], y = dataset_5[1,"X2"])) # Table predicted values vs observed values # Note: Variable X3 is well explained by X4 imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%         select(`x_disc_miss[1, 1]`)%>%         dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%         unlist() cbind(imputed_values, rep(dataset_5[1,"X3"], rep = 1500)) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("Predicted","True")) %>%   table() #>          True #> Predicted    1 #>         1 1495 #>         2    6

title: Worked Examples
text: can fit DPMM missing data ‘X1’/‘X3’/‘X4’ present original dataset. Let’s introduce misisngness clusters. fit DPMM whilst standardising values. can check well missing values imputed model fitting. , checking chain 1, can repeated chains. First check ‘X3’, well explained ‘X2’. check ‘X4’, well explained ‘X2’ two categories. check ‘X1’, well explained ‘X2’.
code: dataset_missing <- dataset_5 dataset_missing[1,"X1"] <- NA dataset_missing[1,"X3"] <- factor(NA, levels = levels(dataset_5[,"X3"])) dataset_missing[1,"X4"] <- factor(NA, levels = levels(dataset_5[,"X4"])) posteriors <- runModel(dataset_missing,                         mcmc_iterations = 2500,                         L = 6,                         standardise = FALSE) #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: alpha, muL, phiL, tauL, v, x_cont_miss, x_disc_miss, z #> ===== Samplers ===== #> RW_wishart sampler (1) #>   - R1[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (2) #>   - alpha #>   - kappa1 #> posterior_predictive sampler (2) #>   - x_disc_miss[]  (2 elements) #> conjugate sampler (29) #>   - v[]  (5 elements) #>   - phiL[]  (12 multivariate elements) #>   - muL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #>   - tauL[]  (6 multivariate elements) #> conditional_RW sampler (1) #>   - x_cont_miss[1, 1:2]  #> categorical sampler (1000) #>   - z[]  (999 elements) #>   - zmiss[]  (1 element) #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_disc_miss[1, 1]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() cbind(imputed_values, rep(dataset_5[1,"X3"], rep = 1500)) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("Predicted","True")) %>%   table() #>          True #> Predicted    1 #>         1 1498 #>         2    3 imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_disc_miss[1, 2]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() cbind(imputed_values, rep(dataset_5[1,"X4"], rep = 1500)) %>%   as.data.frame() %>%    rlang::set_names(c("Predicted","True")) %>%   table() #>          True #> Predicted   1 #>         1 752 #>         2 741 #>         3   6 #>         4   2 imputed_values <- as_tibble(posteriors$samples$chain1)%>%   select(`x_cont_miss[1, 1]`)%>%   dplyr::slice(1000:2500)%>%   unlist() ggplot() +   geom_density(aes(x = imputed_values)) +   geom_vline(aes(xintercept = dataset_5[1,"X1"]))
